channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked since first reported Nov 2023, 12th January
item.description:
This is the fourth report which I have made since Nov 2023. So far no corrective action or repair has been evident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Close, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nothing has changed, 12th January
item.description:
Nothing has changed. Everything remains exactly the same as before, except that one of the reports has now been marked with a green tick. The condition of the road itself is still exactly as it was 15 years ago, with no real improvement whatsoever. I’ve been reporting the same issue for two years now, and it’s clear that giving more time won’t change anything. As shown in the attached photos, the street has been in poor condition since at least 2009 — something that can easily be verified through Google Maps imagery — although it’s very likely it has been this way for even longer. Sixteen years is quite unacceptable. Last year, after numerous complaints on this platform (more than ten), a small section of the street was finally repaired. However, both Elmfield Avenue and Elmfield Street remain in a severe state of neglect. There are potholes throughout, growing larger each time, and in this year’s 2025 photo — next to the maroon car — you can clearly see that the ground is sinking, creating a large puddle every time it rains. The pavements are also in very poor condition: cracked, uneven, and full of holes. I intend to continue reporting these issues regularly until appropriate maintenance work is carried out. Sixteen years without proper repairs is more than enough.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Elmfield Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
